qas.question: When did Hyderabad become important culturally in India?
Which two groups had an influence in making Hyderabad a cultural center?
What culture is most represented in the food of Hyderabad?
Hyderabad has India's second biggest film production industry, what is it called?

context: Relics of Qutb Shahi and Nizam rule remain visible today, with the Charminar—commissioned by <a0_0>Muhammad Quli Qutb<a0_0/> Shah—coming to symbolise Hyderabad. Golconda fort is another major landmark. The influence of <a3_0>Mughlai culture<a3_0/> is also evident in the city's distinctive cuisine, which includes Hyderabadi biryani and Hyderabadi haleem. <a2_0>The Qutb Shahis and Nizams<a2_0/> established Hyderabad as a cultural hub, attracting men of letters from different parts of the world. Hyderabad emerged as the foremost centre of culture in India with the decline of the Mughal Empire in <a1_0>the mid-19th century<a1_0/>, with artists migrating to the city from the rest of the Indian subcontinent. While Hyderabad is losing its cultural pre-eminence, it is today, due to the <a4_0>Telugu film industry<a4_0/>, the country's second-largest producer of motion pictures.
